result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Michael Pottebaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) [Modifiers: Penalty-Intox. Operation of Motor Vehicle, Modifier - Minor Passenger], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation today December 5, 2014.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Carey, ADA: K Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared.  Amended information filed by the State.  Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights.  Court reads charge and possible penalties.  Def pleads No Contest.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty.  Sentencing agreement outlined.  

Sentence:  S/W -  2 yrs probation with conditions to include:
- 30 days SCC jail (good time applies and huber privileges) to commence on Jan 2, 2015 by 6pm
- 12 mos DL revocation
- FF $1109.00/plus $52.00 to the Sheriff's Dept for cost of blood draw thru pay plan
- Ignition interlock
- AODA and follow thru with recommendations
- Pay $52.00 to the Sheriff's Department for blood draw cost (pay plan thru Clerk's office)
- Absolute sobriety for the duration of probation.  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Def advised of right to appeal.  Sign up for probation today.
Plea hearing on December 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Evenson,ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared. Case called at 4:00pm. Scheduled for a PTC.  There is an agreement. DE has case 14CF147 pending in Branch 3 set for plea on 12-05-2014.  Atty Gherty requests plea for same date on this file. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
from Handgun Hotline. Clerk fax'd on 10/14/2014. km
Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Bond is to be Co-Signed by SURETY NAME:  Ronald Pottebaum.
  
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Not to drive motor vehicle.

Defendant may travel with adult supervision.

Defendant to reside with parents.

Defendant may go to work but straight to work and straight home when work is done for the day.
  
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty,  DF:  Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared.  Atty Gherty would like a continued status.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Warrick, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty and DF: Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared. Case called at 11:07 am. Sgt Deputy Jeff Kennett.  ADA McKinley requests the court take note of case # 14CF147. Atty Gherty does not object. Court takes judicial notice of 14CF147. Direct by ADA Hahn. Defendant identified. Court notes ID of defendant. Cross by Atty Gherty. Sgt. excused. Crt finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Def father, co-signer, states he will be out of town for work but his wife, def's mom, will be home. Bond continues in form and amount. Not to drive motor vehicle.

Reside with parents. Defendant not free to come and go. Defendant to only leave in the presence of his parents: Ronald and Joann Pottebaum.

Defendant may go to work but straight to work and straight home when work is done for the day.
  
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Preliminary hearing on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
